content: Which U.S. President delivered the Gettysburg Address, a brief but powerful speech during the Civil War, in November 1863?

The U.S. President who delivered the Gettysburg Address was Abraham Lincoln. This speech is considered one of the most important in American history, as it redefined the purpose of the Civil War and emphasized the principles of human equality and democracy. The speech was delivered on November 19, 1863, at the dedication of the Soldiers' National Cemetery in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania, following the Union victory in the Battle of Gettysburg.
